website_summaries.verdict: The king of all food processors. Designed for power, efficiency, and user satisfaction. Best on the market.
cons: Not as much speed flexibility as some other models, but a wide array of blades compensate for this

customer_reviews.title: Very poor product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this food processor as a gift which was wonderful, however after three uses the plastic mount which the bowl sets on began to crack and eventually broke into pieces. When I called customer service they were great and sent me another right away. The second one lasted about 4 uses and the same mount cracked and broke off. The third one and then the fourth one.. need I say more. This is a defective product. I am now sending it back to get a full refund. I will have to say customer service has been great!
customer_reviews.author: Jonnie D.

customer_reviews.title: My Breville hands down is a great food processor
customer_reviews.text: My Breville hands down is a great food processor; however, I am disappointed that the plastic bowl failed at after the warranty period [verified purchase 4-11-2016]. My wife doesn't use it often; however, when needed it processed like a dream. The plastic bowl and the metal sprocket in the middle seemed at odds when put to the task. As per photos, the crack is very noticeable and began to leak the contents. After looking closely at the bowl, we realized the plastic bowl had failed. In the end, I am sure that if my wife had used the processor with higher regularity, we would have encountered the problem sooner. Very disappointed to say-the-least.
customer_reviews.author: r romero

customer_reviews.title: Breville👎
customer_reviews.text: If I could write less than 1 star I would. Very disappointed in this product considering all of the hype of it being the best of the best. It can't chop Parmesan up which my 25 year old Cuisinart can still do. I have very basic needs and it doesn't fulfill them. I would never recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good product with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Not only does my Breville food processor work perfectly but I had to contact customer service because a part failed and they provided excellent service. I very small part in the lid failed about 7 months after I purchased this processor. I emailed customer service and they responded immediately. Once I sent them a picture of the failed part so they could ascertain what needed to be replaced they wrote up an order and got the part sent as soon as it was in stock. They really stood behind their warranty and I appreciate that!
customer_reviews.author: Supergoo

customer_reviews.title: Plastic parts melted
customer_reviews.text: I had this lovely machine for three days before it overheated making pizza dough. The dough blade heated into the plastic (yes, plastic) at the top of the lid. When taking the lid off, the dough blade came out attached to the lid. This was caused by the hot plastic melting onto it. While trying to get the dough blade released, I burned my finger. The heat from the machine killed the yeast, so my dough was useless. Contacted Breville by email and sent pictures and have yet to recieve a response. For $400.00 one should expect better performance and service from the manufacturer. Don't use this machine for dough. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all my life??? I have had other brands of food processors, so did some research, for it was time to switch. This was always rated as top of the line, and many reviews said that most cooks don’t need to spend the money on this, buy the next one down.. Well, if you like to cook, BUY THIS. it is worth twice what I spent for it. It has good solid parts, metal where it is needed. Strong shafts. It shreds parmagane as if it were butter. It does a beautiful job of thin slicing vegetables, very thin, if that is what one wants. Let me tell you, I am in love
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Bowls break!
customer_reviews.text: Bowls break WAY too easily. We’ve easily gone through three in less than a year and have been told we can’t get another replacement. Paid way too much for this machine to have to deal with this.
customer_reviews.author: John Maynard

customer_reviews.title: It's AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheaper food processor (Oster) and returned it. SO GLAD I DID. This thing is amazing. Makes great nice cream (frozen bananas only, please try them) and also makes great vegan brownies (walnuts, dates, almond butter and cocoa) with no trouble whatsoever. It's great looking and easy to clean. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Peter A

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: A nightmare. Before I ever used the machine, I installed a disk improperly and it became stuck. I called the company, accepted that it was my error, and paid for replacement parts. Two months later I still don't have the parts. Because I bought this from Amazon, I don't have the luxury of returning it to a store. Terrible from every angle. BTW - Breville online support - a joke - on "hold" for twenty minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Perlstein

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine!  Except...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous food processor. It is extremely powerful and has the blades and disks that make it very effective for multiple tasks. The grating disk is reversible, one side with larger holes the other side with finer holes. The slicing disk is adjustable to slice things thinly or thickly, from shaving swiss cheese to thick slices of, say, carrots. The only thing that I don't like about it is that the base is plastic. Had I known that, I wouldn't have purchased it. I know that this won't bother many people but all the plastic I've purchased over the years will survive me by thousands of years. That bothers me.
customer_reviews.author: Little house on an island

customer_reviews.title: A solid performer
customer_reviews.text: This food processor is a beast. The large feed throat makes it easy to put large vegetables into it whole. The slicer can make the thinnest slices out of even the most delicate vegetables like tomatoes. It handles doughs with ease. The bowl is large enough to do the job of a full recipe without trouble. And if that isn't enough it does all of this quietly. This slices and shreds through everything at barely above a whisper.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: Mama's new kitchen toy...
customer_reviews.text: It's big but love the fact that it replaces my mini chopper and the Accessories are well organized and contained in a space saving container. To date I have shredded cheese, made cocoa chili almond butter, and keto friendly fudge balls. hope to use it enough to "justify" the price I paid for this. Shouldn't be too hard! Seriously, this was the best Christmas gift I ever bought myself! Cleanup...well.... takes a little more work than just popping in the dishwasher, but then again...I want to keep this thing for a long time and so I will hand wash along with my very expensive knives!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: An amazing food processor.
customer_reviews.text: An amazing food processor. We have had ours for about a year and haven't had any problems with it. The only complaints I have are 1) it is hard to clean, the best way I have found is to put some water in it and run it for a few seconds before actually cleaning it. 2) The handle must be facing the front, over the controls, for the machine to work. If it is facing the back you will get an error that the plunger is not in and the machine will refuse to work.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R Hunt

customer_reviews.title: This is a great food processor
customer_reviews.text: I love my new food processor. It comes with its own case for the blades. There are quite a few different blades that are so useful. It is easy to clean and even comes with its own cleaning brush. It's very easy to change blades etc. I was going to buy Cuisinart as I've had in the past, but then looked on consumer reports and also the reviews on Amazon and realized that this is a better quality, better-rated product and the only one that I found that was highly rated and had all the blades I wanted and its own case for those blades.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chips in blade had less than a week!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this a few days ago, I have used it to chop nuts and mix some sauces. I have hand washed and VERY sad to see a few chips on the blade. I have NO clue how this happened and not sure who to contact. I literally retired a cuisine art and splurged to get this because I have been waiting for my other to need to be replaced. Saddened by this and even more sad that now I have to go through the headache of contacting them to find out WHY?! Check your blades...this should not happen. What happen to the metal parts as it is not dinged or dented, it’s missing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: It is ridiculous that I have to spend an additional $199 for the dicing compatibility kit and another $129 for two additional size dicing blades. A full feature food processor should be able to dice as part of the basic package. After using this blender for several months I have to upgrade it to 5 stars, despite my earlier post. It is the do-all, do everything product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P

customer_reviews.title: Great processor!
customer_reviews.text: It is quite fancy and even comes with a garage to store all her accessories. Ours is used in a commercial setting, so she does overheat for us occasionally - but only because we push her beyond her limits on the daily. But she perseveres every time and comes back to life. The only qualm we might have is the inserts for her feeder are a little fragile, one drop on the floor and it was chipped and cracked. Still works fine, just not as pretty. Great processor, large capacity, good stamina, easy to clean, and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: KrishaLou

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after six years!
customer_reviews.text: We've used ours for just about everything for six years. Excellent. I wouldn't trade it for anything. Nothing has broken during that time! The only negative I can say is it's not the best for pizza dough, I only tried that once for fun. If you want to make a lot of pizza dough, then the better tool is a stand mixer, that's what we use for dough.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Day Hiker

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: After many reviews, I decided on this food processor and have been very happy. I have easily made pie crusts, icings, and sliced potatoes for home fries. As a safety feature, which most have, you can't use the chute unless the top is on. That means veggies usually need to be cut for to a max length. It's very quiet. I find it easy to clean by hand. Definitely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dg5476

customer_reviews.title: Both items arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: The food processor arrived broken. I ordered a replacement and that arrived broken too. I will likely get my money back but not my time. Very frustrating. I am not ordering this a third time.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Breville is in a class of its own!
customer_reviews.text: Top. Notch. Product. Look for the newest model which has been updated to include a dicing kit. I've used this food processor daily since it arrived and sometimes 2 or 3 times a day. This monster of a machine will last a lifetime. Pull the trigger and purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Great but not acceptable
customer_reviews.text: Not Dishwasher safe, you kidding me Breville!! This might be the best machine but if you cant use the Dishwasher after every use it becomes a pain. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: I prepare salad with it everyday.  What a pleasure!  Really easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: The safety features are impressive as are the design. Everything is clearly labeled, the plug has a loop to put your hand into (3rd pic above). The motor will not run unless the pusher is inserted into the chute (2nd pic). The storage box is carefully laid out and clearly labeled. AND it works great! Everything from french fries to tomatoes, carrots to mushrooms. It's pricey and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Helen and Ev

customer_reviews.title: Blades need improvement
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great except for the french fry blade, it cuts the potato's too small, and leaves a lot of mush, the blade needs to have a larger cut, 1/4 in at least, it's is about 1/8 to 3/16 now and waist a lot of potatoes, this is one of the reasons I bout this. Also, the base is very heavy, it's a food processor not a tank altho it's built like one. So not for the weak if you plan on storing it overhead
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite kitchen appliance. Hummus is fabulous. Pesto is fabulous. Everything I attempt to make is fabulous in this food processor. The best feature is the clock/timer that begins when starting any mixture. I know know exactly how long each recipe requires. Watch out when you clean because blades are extremely sharp. I can't count the number of times I've cut myself while washing. Even so, this is still my go-to kitchen appliance.
customer_reviews.author: claire

customer_reviews.title: This machine is awesome already! Oh
customer_reviews.text: First, I ordered it last night and UPS delivered it this afternoon! Shockingly fast! Having just received this processor, I have only one use under my belt -- french fries! This machine whipped out those bubbas quicker than I could say "WOW!" I saw a You Tube review give this blade a "C" so why I tried it first. I'm impressed. This machine is awesome already! Oh, also, another online review (not one of Amazon's reviews) a gal said that the lid was really difficult to put on. I laughed to myself as I wondered how much vino she had sipped while trying it. The lid is so dang easy to lock in place.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Grundvig

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I purchased this machine. I have scalloped potatoes, prepared oranges, lemons, limes by slicing thin for my dehydrator, I have chopped pounds and pounds of coleslaw and included many fun vegetables to go into it. I now keep coarsely chopped nuts in the freezer and can make kapusta without much fuss. I find that it cleans easy and the compartment for the blades is very convenient and helps keep my shelves neat. I was able to slice chicken easily in small pieces for chicken jerky. So far, I am more than pleased with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Novak

customer_reviews.title: Bread is a no go
customer_reviews.text: This machine chops and shreds adequately. Nothing special. It does not handle bread well, and quickly overheats and stops. Customer service was not at all helpful, and tried to sell me replacements parts without addressing my actual problem. I don't know if there's a better processor out there, but I would not buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: damaged plastic area in food processor
customer_reviews.text: just received this product for mother's day, and was really excited to use it and I find a damaged area inside the food processor where some of the plastic has chipped off. This unit is $400 and should arrive in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: Good buy! One great feature was the adjustable slicer
customer_reviews.text: Good buy! One great feature was the adjustable slicer. Another was the small chopper included. Takes up a good bit of space on my counter but as I need more help with my chopping, shredding, slicing, etc because of occasional discomfort in hands and wrist, I leave it out. As we make sauerkraut, do lots of food preservation, lots of baking I've not taken advantage of all the features, but look forward to doing so. Is relative quiet and the large bowl is a plus. Excited about using it even more than I have.
customer_reviews.author: leeny

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty food processor.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this food processor. It’s sturdy on the counter and makes fast work if everything I’ve tried. Easy to clean but be cautious of cleaning the blades as they are super sharp. The storage case is wonderful with everything labeled. Fits great in my pullout drawers in my cabinets. My only “complaint“ is that it is very noisy but I will our up with that for the amount of power it puts out!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Solid processor, just what I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Appliance manufacturers have been making cheaper and cheaper products but not true for this Breville! While others may ne lighter weight, this is a substantial and powerful processor. Rated it 4 starts only because I’m overwhelmed with all the options. Just haven’t figured it all out yet. Love the slicing blade that allows various thickness. Perfection! Never made better sweet potato chips!
customer_reviews.author: Steviesmom

customer_reviews.title: Lid cover has a spring based trigger for the power ..
customer_reviews.text: I used this item once a while for big parties. And the unit works grate when the lid's sensor is working. But this lid sensor is based on the spring if the spring is loose or does not press properly by the pusher then whole unit is useless .. HOWEVER, THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE IS SUPPER. I used the unit literally less than 10 times and the motor trigger is broken..
customer_reviews.author: Sameem Samad

customer_reviews.title: Obnoxiously Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Do I really like my Breville? Yes I do. However, it is extremely noisy and I wish I could upload the video I took of this noise that drowns out everything in the apartment. It disturbs everyone watching tv. My son has to close his room door and is still bothered by the sound. At this point I do not think it's normal. Is it? and I've ONLY used it for light work like puree avocados, I have yet to put it to any test but so far I am very worried. with such a price tag I expect much better. I sure everyone can't possibly be happy with the sound. Imagine it running for 10 minutes. SMH
customer_reviews.author: Streamer

customer_reviews.title: To receive what I actually  ordered
customer_reviews.text: So far this food processor is working great, the blades are razor sharp a d clean up is a breeze. Now for what I didn't like, I ordered the stainless steel one originally, I was charged the stainless steel price $399.95 plus $27.00 tax. total came to $ 426.95. I was sent Brushed metal. At a stainless steel price. I called amazon customer service and they did help to take care of my issue. Just make sure you get what you pay for.. my order was correct and the person at the other end didn't pay attention and shipped the wrong color. That being said I love the machine a d I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power--love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big home cook and baker and have used this every day since I received it. Makes homemade peanut butter in no time flat. Chops nuts, blends, you name it. I'll be using it for pie crust this weekend. Only con is it's heavy. I mean 25 lbs. heavy but I keep it close by and it's worth it for the additional power.
customer_reviews.author: maryannd

customer_reviews.title: Breville does it again with this food processor.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Can't say anything but Breville does it again with this food processor. Outstanding build quality and design with tons of flexibility. SO far using it about once per week. Processing cabbage for slaw, I have tried the larger grating blade and it did well. Recently tried the julienne blade. With this blade the orientation of the cabbage in the hopper allows you to get a slightly larger/coarser product that with the shredder - worked great.
customer_reviews.author: JPSilver

customer_reviews.title: Best in Class. Very Classy too!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving my new food processor. The speed and volume it can hold are way better than my old Cuisanart. The consistency of the slices, diced veggies is perfect. And love the dial to control the thickness of slices. The only complaint I have is the recommendation that you unplug the device before opening it each time which seems a little bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FELL APART AFTER TWO YEARS
customer_reviews.text: The motor is powerful and still works. The housing is still and very hard to place the lids on. The blades have to be yanked out with force...everything is stiff and very hard to use. I would not recommend this item. It is already cracking. I would think it would have lasted longer!
customer_reviews.author: mabarker

customer_reviews.title: Salsa, sauce and shred lettuce like a five-star restaurant!
customer_reviews.text: I put this machine to the test chopping garden produce for a week of canning. The slicing blade shreds lettuce to perfection; the small bowl minces fresh herbs like you can't believe; the chopping blades create a fine, even-cut product without the irregular pieces of vegetables from "competitors". I've been cooking for decades and by far, this is the best food processor on the market. P.S. There is an opening for drizzling oil/liquids while processing (some people were leaving questions about that).
customer_reviews.author: Seazie

customer_reviews.title: Big and scary
customer_reviews.text: This thing is scary. Intimidates the heck out of me. I have the 16 cup. Not sure what I was thinking. Should have bought the smaller version. Love the case for blades, but it takes up a lot of space. A whole shelf in my cabinet goes to blades, another to the base and cups.
customer_reviews.author: Trina  Peddicord

customer_reviews.title: works great, lower noise
customer_reviews.text: I love the accessory storage case & the variety of disks & blades that come with this processor. It replaced my Ninja food processor, which was a bit more powerful, but this has a bigger (& a smaller) bowl & wide mouth chute. It's also less loud. Its a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Donutmail

customer_reviews.title: Cool bit o trivia - this is the same one ...
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars of course. It's a Breville. Cool bit o trivia - this is the same one used on the show Cut Throat Kitchen. I had to play with it a bit to learn how to get good cuts. Be patient, you'll learn and love it. I owned their masticating juicer for 3 years. That's 3 years of near daily use. And when I broke the bowl, they replaced it free after warranty. Customer service is great. Both worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Linea

customer_reviews.title: Bought this after serious injury using hand grater
customer_reviews.text: I am from the old school and grate my cabbage with hand held grater. I am thankful I still have my thumb but after 8 months I still have nerve pain on the tip. I finally wised up and got this great food processor. I grated cabbage in seconds and clean up was super quick too. Now I am excited to use it for all my vegetables and will try puree-ing and more. I am glad I chose this quality food processor. I don't like buying poor quality products that break easily. This machine is the King Kong of them all! Wow! Jane B
customer_reviews.author: Jane B

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and fast motor gets the job done quickly. I haven't had the problem with anything breaking/cracking like the other reviews post. I do hand-wash all components. I also am careful not to store the main canister in the locked position (per the instructions) so as to not keep it under the constant high tension (wonder if this is why it has cracked for other people?). Worst part is that the chopping blade cuts things up very quickly, you must only use the pulse button at 1-2 second intervals or you end up with finely minced product.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. I was hesitant to spend so much ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. I was hesitant to spend so much on this in case I would not use it and have another appliance that just takes up space. It is heavy and large yet so very worth it for the power. It does everything and my favorite is the blade that slices onions and other vegetables extremely thin - great for pizza. This product is worth the money and the space it takes. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: It's even better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: After seven months of deliberation and comparison, I finally decided on the Breville BFP800XL Sous Chef Food Processor. I already have heavy duty blenders, mixers, and choppers. It's even better than I expected. It's solid, not too heavy; fits under my cabinets if I set the bowl in place separately; quiet and powerful; and makes short work of shredding, chopping, slicing. Love the accessories holder. (Be careful of the sharp blades....) Completely delighted with this kitchen addition!
customer_reviews.author: IDA

customer_reviews.title: Best on the Market (As far as I'm aware)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible! Hands down the best food processor I've ever used. And I'm including robot coups that I've used at work in that comparison. You can do sooooo much with this and the blades are crazy sharp. Seriously, watch out for the blades. I got a sort of deep cut from one of them. But if you're in the market for a food processor and are willing to spend the money, this is definitely the best you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Horowitz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, sleek, many cutting discs
customer_reviews.text: Such an excellent food processor with an abundance of cutting discs to cut thin to thick. Love the smaller bowl for cutting small amounts. The storage case for the parts is excellent for keeping organized. Also, it is so sleek, classy and contemporary on our counter. Doesn’t move all over the counter while using it...very sturdy. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: UJS

customer_reviews.title: Breville 16 cup food processor
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something powerful enough to make dough and butter. Ive had a couple other smaller food processors and they just didn’t have the power and the motors would burn up. I absolutely love this food processor! It’s very powerful and easy to clean and I absolutely love the separate container for all the attachments and of course all the attachments! It is a large machine and it is heavy. But well worth the price and as long as it’s taken care of properly (hand wash only) I’m sure will last a life time!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Renoud

customer_reviews.title: Quality is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I had originally gotten a different less expensive food processor from a different popular manufacturer and was very disappointed. I bought this one and ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!! Wow what a difference. Very well built and can handle so much. Now I’m looking to buy other Brevelle products. Quality is fantastic!!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Macri

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic parts
customer_reviews.text: I had a cuisenart for twenty years and while the plastic parts always broke after awhile the parts on this Breville are much cheaper and breaking more quickly. It's still functional at this point but I have my doubts about how much longer it will last. And I've only had it a year!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Holland

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I received the Breville Sous Chef BFP800 XL after ordering as a birthday gift for myself. I currently had and old Cuisenart. I did extensive research and found this was rated one of the best in the market. I was not disappointed. I love it. I watched the you tube videos to get the most out of the product. I have just ordered the adapter and kit for the peel and dice attachments as most of my prep is with onions, tomatoes etc. I cannot wait until it arrives. In the meantime I have made perfect guacamole, and fratatias.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Stover

customer_reviews.title: Love my Breville
customer_reviews.text: I've used it multiple times since purchasing and it makes perfect almond butter without added oils in 15 minutes. I do wish it would rotate just a little faster, but it does a good job. Power over speed. I also wish the timer/counter would go above 9 minutes. When it is running and hits 10 it shuts off. That might be a good feature to keep it from overheating but I then have to restart it again. But overall, I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Pollkat

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! I'm in love.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing food processor. You are getting the best bang for your buck and its very very high quality! Even if you weren't planning to spend this much on a food processor its worth the extra money for the quality of this product. You will NOT be sorry. The power of this food processor amazes me every time.
customer_reviews.author: orly jackel

customer_reviews.title: A well made machine.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful Food Processor. A well made machine. The metal and plastic are very high grade. It is a great add to any kitchen. The motor drive on this machine is one of the strongest on the market. There in lies the problem, the motor, being what it is, a strong and reliable, comes with a down side, its very heavy. You will need a designated area in your kitchen for this product. It is not a unit that can be stored and retrieved when needed without making preparation.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wozniak

customer_reviews.title: Good processor, difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: For many things it's a great processor and has lots of useful attachments. However the small inside bowl is exceptionally difficult to remove. The blade requires much work to get it off before the bowl can be eased out of the larger bowl. Both large and small blades are difficult to remove. I hesitate to use it because of the removal difficulty. At times the blade comes off with such force that it scatters whatever was being processed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Unes

customer_reviews.title: Can’t replace the bowl?
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Bowl is broken and not replaceable. I’ve had this for about a year and half. You can get cheaper versions of these for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Intended to buy a less expensive food processor, but bought this instead because Consumer Reports gave it the highest rating for slicing veggies. Glad I bought this one! It slices and dices mountains of veggies (onions, mushrooms, carrots, celery, eggplant, jalapeño, etc) beautifully in minutes and then cleans up quickly. I use it at least several times per week. It's fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: MNtea

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: After 20+ years of loyal service, my cuisinart died. I did some research and decided to invest in this beast! What power, what speed! I feel like I have been pedaling on trike instead of flying on a Ducati. Worth every dollar and has a ton of features I never knew I needed until now.
customer_reviews.author: Henri'

customer_reviews.title: Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a smaller machine (different brand) that made awful noise. My best friend has had this machine for 18 months and I have used it at her house. I cook a lot and use my food processor almost daily. This machine has the power to grate hard cheeses and makes smooth purees. I never put any part in the dishwasher, even though it says you can. I love the separate storage box for the multiple blades and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gingrich

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 Cuisinarts and 1 Kitchenaid bit the dust in 6 months ( I only had the Kitchenaid for 3 weeks, and the spindle stripped out), I researched and found this as the Consumer Reports best. So I bit the bullet and paid the extra $$. I'm glad I did, it's fantastic and I think I could probably grind rocks in it. I won't but it works like a dream, is strong, has great features PLUS I love the accessory storage case included. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality but you pay for it.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of horsepower, could be used In a restaurant. Very big and heavy almost too cumbersome for a small lady but it does get the job done fast. You get what you pay for. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: GARY BURKE

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor I've ever owned.  Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I owned 5 differenthe food processors over the years and this Braville is by far the best one yet. It replaces my 14 cup Cuisinart and out performs it easily. Just thenter adjustable slicing blade had me sold but the uniformity of the chopping blade is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice food processor.
customer_reviews.text: I make ALOT of cake pops. This does a great job making my cake pop dough out of my cake shavings. I also use this to make cookie crumbs for my cheese cake crusts. It is ALOT more quiet than my 10 year old Kitchenaid that I gave to my daughter when I got this one. It cleans up well and looks great. The attachments are very nice sand so is the case they are stored in. My Kitchenaid case was very cheesy. We now have it at home and are using it for RAW food meals for my son. My daughter n law says it works great for every thing they are making.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Wyckoff Sciara

customer_reviews.title: This machine is a monster!
customer_reviews.text: This machine replaced my old Cuisinart, and I am very happy with it. So far, I have only used it to process vegetables, but it has done an excellent job. It works amazingly fast. The reversible and adjustable discs are a very clever feature. The spindle and chopping blade do not fall out when the bowl is tipped over to empty it, the way they did with the old Cuisinart. It does take some space to store the case of blades.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel W Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Love it for my Indian cooking!
customer_reviews.text: Right from cutting karela ( bitter gourd) to bhindi to making chutney ,mincing garlic and ginger.making chapati dough.its a perfect food processor.have been using it daily for almost a month.i had a Cusinart dlc 10s before.but I like this better because of the adjustable slicing disc.
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh Roy

customer_reviews.title: I am super happy with this food processor!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this food processor!! It is a workhorse! I can make super creamy almond/nut butter in less than 5 minutes! It shreds, chops, blends, makes icecream out of frozen bananas in 1 minute, the adjustable slicing blade makes perfect sized potato chips, easy to clean, includes every blade/disc I could ever need. Solid machine.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Rocks, going strong five years later, great for margaritas, hummus, grating cheese, mixing doughs, and more!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Best ever worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I always bought low priced food processors. I just thought chopping and grating was not too complicated. But one day while bored I decided to buy this processor. What a difference!!!!! Everything is chopped evenly and quickly. There are all sorts of attachments to even use for bread. The purée really purées. The unit is large but attractive. I keep it on my counter because I use it so often. It can replace a blender, kitchen aid, although I use both because I bake so much bread, hand mixer (yummy whipped cream even homemade butter). I haven't regretted the purchase for a second. Who knew what a difference it would make in my cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie P. Garth

customer_reviews.title: Quality, results and ease of everything. This machine is the Top Dog
customer_reviews.text: If you’re wanting the perfect food processor, then this is it. I’m totally in love with mine. Yes it’s more expensive. But quality and results cost more. The accessories are spot on. Especially love the adjustable slicing blade. My next purchase will be the two other blade sets. NOTE: these blades are EXTREMELY sharp. Especially the slicing blade. Always reset it to zero before washing. It slices finger meat and fingernails quickly if you don’t pay attention.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Tucker

customer_reviews.title: The only reason this doesnt 5 stars is the lack ...
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this doesnt 5 stars is the lack of a dicer. Its quiet.can handle large batches properly. Has a huge chute and is solid ad a rock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great food processor!
customer_reviews.text: I love it, except that you have to put a lot in if you're using chopping or mixing blades in order for the blades to catch the food, as the blades don't get close enough to the bottom and sides.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Bowl cracks - twice
customer_reviews.text: We loved it. Then it leaked. The bowl where the drive mechanism connects to the motor cracked after 5-6 weeks. CS was great to talk to but they had to back order the part (wonder why). When it failed to show after two weeks, they sent a whole new machine and we returned the old one. Now, three weeks after we got the new machine, the very same crack has appeared again. We had made butter twice and petso once.
customer_reviews.author: Kirman R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Processor does not hop around on counter when using, and it is easy to use and clean. If there was one thing I'd point out, it is that when using the small bowl, contents do splatter into the bigger bowl, therefore, both bowls requires a quick wash & rinse. I can live with that. I'd recommend visiting your local library for the Food Processor Bible for a lot of great ideas too, or buy the book.
customer_reviews.author: Linda 1

customer_reviews.title: Excllent Quality food processor with Great Features
customer_reviews.text: Have had this machine for a few days now and only shredded cheese for lasagna but I think it is going to be a very good purchase. After looking at many reviews I think this is the way to go for the quality and ease of use. The storage case is far better than my previous brand and the extra large feed tube is a major improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Gold Nugget

customer_reviews.title: Great food processor
customer_reviews.text: Only used twice so far. It grates, slices, and cuts fries well. I thought it would be nice if it would make two different size fries. It's great for making pie crust. I like the adjustment for different size slices. The spatula seems to scrap the bowl perfect and makes everything come out easy and the brush is great for cleaning the blades. I haven't used every attachment yet, but can't wait to try all of them. I wish it would cut food into small cubes. It chopped my potatoes up too much, but maybe I just need more practice. I would recommend this food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but be careful with the sharp pieces!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how easy it is to assemble and disassemble. I did get cut on the first day of cleaning, so be careful with the sharp pieces. I do not even bother cleaning those by hand. I put those straight into the back of the dishwasher as soon as I am done. Putting them in the back of the dishwasher makes it less likely that anyone will accidentally bump into them when loading and unloading. I guess it goes without saying to keep away from children!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor available
customer_reviews.text: This is our second 16 cup Breville food processor. The first one was accidentally set on a hot stove and the cord was burned. Even at nearly $400 it was 100% worth it to replace this. We have a family of 7 so even simple dishes require a lot of food. This food processor is a champ. It has been able to handle everything we've thrown at it. It's super easy to clean and I love the mini bowl for when we're whooping up a snack or a milkshake.
customer_reviews.author: Jacy

customer_reviews.title: and it does not have those stupid edges that catch food that make it hard to ...
customer_reviews.text: Wasting Time With All the Wrong Machines! I have tried the major brands, and I will tell you that they do not hold a candle to the Breville 16 Cup BFP800XL Sous Chef Food Processor! It is powerful; it is simple to use; and it does not have those stupid edges that catch food that make it hard to get food out! I simple love mine! When it arrived, I could not wait to get it out of the box, wash the parts, and grate parmesan cheese; simply put: it was a piece of cake! Not literally of course! I believe it is going to be a love affair with my Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I liked my expensive name brand food processor and used it for years. When the motor gave out, I bought this one. Far superior to the other well know brand.
customer_reviews.author: Little LuLu

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Food Processor!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful food processor that works perfectly! Has all the tools needed to chop, shred, grate and make meals effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this machine! It is a multifaceted workhorse. Rarely am I so impressed with kitchen equipment, but this has won me over. I praised it so much my mom went out and bought one too. It is heavy, which is good, but if you are not strong make sure you put it in a place where you can access it without having to move it.
customer_reviews.author: The Urban Felix

customer_reviews.title: It does everything beautifully you can think to do in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 for my adult children. It does everything beautifully you can think to do in the kitchen, plus some you haven't. Only downside is the size. It does take a lot of space. But no one is willing to give up their Breville Food Processor or any of its attachments.
customer_reviews.author: P R.

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life easier!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very busy lifestyle and this has definitely made things a lot quicker at the end of the day. I have used this to make mustard, horse radish, Crust, cake mixes, shredding and making fries. It has worked flawlessly, so far. Once I have used it for a while longer, I will try to update and maybe take some photos as well. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: R J S

customer_reviews.title: Makes short work of prep
customer_reviews.text: Love this processor. the disk with adjustable thickness is the best. The small bowl makes easy work of mayo prep and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Corkhill

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Was it possible to have gotten a better machine? NO, I don't believe so! This machine has sliced, diced, smashed, kneaded and blended so many things for me that I can't find a place to begin my praise. I haven't had any issues with the attachments. I find it very easy to use and it has a place when not being used beneath my counter in a cabinet. The container to hold the attachments is beneath the counter as well and very handy as the attachments are sharp and I have small children around the house at all times. I would recommend this food processor to anyone who asked my opinion on such a machine.
customer_reviews.author: Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen small appliance ever
customer_reviews.text: Great help in the kitchen. My wife doesn't need my help cutting onions anymore! This makes her old food processor look like a relic. This has become her favorite Breville out of seven small kitchen appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best food processor I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best food processor I have ever had, and I have had a few! It far surpasses the Cusinart Elite that I had which died after a couple of years. It is well made, the accessories are in a plastic box and well labeled. I made gazpacho and it processed the veges in no time. The adjustable slicing disc is fantastic and made gorgeous, consistent slices of the entire cucumber - no waste and no awkward pieces, like with previous food processors. I look forward to using it more and more.
customer_reviews.author: Spachef

customer_reviews.title: Awesome performance and easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: We love our processor! The first thing we used it for was cookie dough, and be aware -- this product is so powerful, you can't run the processor very long at all. The first batch was processed too long, and the dough was warm. On our old processor, it took longer to mix the dough than it does on the Breville. The 2nd batch was just right and very quick. The product cleans up very nicely. The food chute is wide enough to get your hand in it for quick cleaning. We have used it for chopping, and again, the results were quick and the chopped pieces were uniform. We highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: I wasted so much time at the chopping block
customer_reviews.text: I was almost in tears after I chopped veggies for soup in about 4 minutes! I wish I bought this 20 years ago! I wasted so much time at the chopping block!! This processor makes great almond butter, humus, whipped cream. Slicing is breeze. Chopping onions without tears-- priceless! Heavy super solid appliance. This will stay out on the counter top with the tools stored under. Breville designs their cords with an easy pull plug, a must for the safety minded, because I always unplug before I open the top to remove food or change blade.
customer_reviews.author: clinck

customer_reviews.title: Great Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: I know that this costs a lot but you can see the quality as soon as you open the box. Plus USA Company!
customer_reviews.author: S. Vastano

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for a few months and used to make salads and dips. Blades are super sharp, entire unit and accessories are well built. The color wasn’t the vibrant red I was expecting; it’s more of a reddish-pink tone but that’s ok. Storage box for blades is also sturdy and can be stored on side to save shelf space
customer_reviews.author: Sand Badger

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its name
customer_reviews.text: What else can I say? It’s a Breville. PRO: It comes with every attachment you ever need and more. Quality is amazing and stores well on your cabinet. CON: 12 cup I think is too big. I’ll ordered it without realizing how large it is. Also it’s expensive and you’re paying for the name. Overall, I recommend purchase a smaller size. It’ll do what you need and more.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Doucette

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, worth the higher price! I bought this is a replacement for my Cuisinart, which always had various problems. The Breville has a much better design and is easier to clean. I use my food processor for bread making, so it gets quite a bit of use. My husband says it is much easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lori F

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad a bought this machine. Was it pricey? Yeah Was it worth it? Oh Yeah. I keep thinking of things to make just so I can use it. It is so quiet and so fast. The last food processor I had was no loud we had to wear earmuffs when we used it. This one is so quiet you wonder if it's even working. I actually had to run a carrot through it when I first got it to make sure it worked. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone who is looking for the best food processor you'll ever own.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love!!!! Haven't used it to its full capacity, but love it so far!!! Yes it's a large footprint if you keep everything on your counter, but I put the box of parts away out of site, so it doesn't take up much space. Very heavy. Easy to clean. Love the box of parts!!! Last KA I had didn't have that and it was annoying!!!! Just love this!!! Well worth the hefty cost!!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor. Worth the Price.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. More than I ever hoped for in a food processor. Does everything. I especially like the adjustable slicing disk. Can even slice deli meat. Mini food processor attachment very easy for small amounts. Powerful motor. Full of features. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Asaro

customer_reviews.title: Solid. This thing is a workhorse and greatly speeds ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid. This thing is a workhorse and greatly speeds up kitchen tasks. It's also a breeze to clean. Beware of those blades, though - if they even slightly touch you, you'll be bleeding. Not a knock, just a testament to the fact that this machine is powerful.
customer_reviews.author: TheOtherOne

customer_reviews.title: It's lovely.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I bought a cheaper food processor at Walmart and was not happy with it. Took it back and bought this tough SOB. Damn it has some oomf! Love kneading bread dough and making all my own sauces. Cooking is fun now. :)
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

product_meta.title: Breville BFP800XL Sous Chef Food Processor
product_meta.description:
Color:Stainless Steel

All accessories included with the Breville Sous Chef are housed in a convenient plastic container. It can be stored flat or on its side to take up less counter space.  WHY THE BREVILLE SOUS CHEF FOOD PROCESSOR?
Every Breville product begins with a simple moment of brilliance. The Breville Sous Chef began with the observation that the food comes in many different shapes and sizes, making it difficult for one machine to consistently cut all ingredients into the optimal size pieces. So how do you make sure that you get the perfect size for what you’re cooking?

The Breville Sous Chef solves this problem with its unique design. Its wide feed chute makes it possible to slice vegetables of all shapes and sizes, while numerous disc and blade options makes it easy to get perfect results, any way you slice it.

COMBINING CONVENIENCE AND VERSATILITY: THE GREATEST SLICED THING SINCE BREAD.
Food processors are supposed to make food prep easier, not more frustrating. The Breville Sous Chef has a 5.5” Super Wide Feed Chute that reduces the need to pre-cut most fruits & veggies, saving you time.

The Breville Sous Chef comes with a set of 8 discs and blades for numerous prep options, all housed in a convenient accessory storage. The discs include a variable slicing disc that can be set to 24 different slicing settings so you can customize the thickness of your slices from a paper thin 0.3mm all the way up to a thick 8.0mm. Other discs in the set include a julienne disc, a French fry cutting disc, a whisking disc, and a reversible shredding disc, while the blades include a micro-serrated universal S blade, a dough blade for kneading and combining ingredients, and a mini blade for use with mini-bowl. 

The Breville Sous Chef includes two bowls, a large 16 cup processing bowl and a 2.5 cup mini processing bowl, for convenient processing no matter what size portions you’re chopping. The 16-cup option allows you to blend up large servings of soup or dough, while the mini processing bowl is perfect for processing small amounts of sauces or nuts.

Combining slicing options and two size choices with the convenience of the wide mouth chute, it is no wonder that the Breville Sous Chef was rated the best food processor in 2012 by a leading American reviewer of products.

PRODUCT FEATURES


 1.  Small Food Pusher: for improved processing control of smaller ingredients. It also doubles as a measuring cup for adding/measuring ingredients. The food processor will run continually whether the small pusher is in or out
 2.  Large Food Pusher for pushing food down the feed chute. The food processor will not start unless the large pusher is in place correctly.
 3.  Feed Chute Safety System: prevents the motor from operating unless the bowl, lid and large food pusher are correctly locked in position.
 4.  Super Wide Feed Chute so large ingredients don’t have to be chopped before being fed into the food processor
 5.  Silicone Seal: reduces the chance of leakage while processing large volumes of liquid ingredients.
 6.  Processing Bowl: 16 cup bowl for dry ingredients and 12 cups for liquid (wet ingredients). The processing bowl locks onto the motor base.
 7.  LCD Display with Count-Up & Count-Down Timer: used to set desired time required for processing. Can count up or down, stopping the processor once the time is reached in count down mode.
 8.  Solid Die-Cast Metal Base
 9.  Direct Drive Motor: with safety braking system.
 10. Non-Skid Rubber Feet: for added safety and stability.
 11. All parts that come in contact with food are BPA free.



Click on image to view larger.
feature_bullets: Comes with 5 multi function discs and 3 blades out of the box
5.5 inch super wide feed chute reduces the need to pre cut most fruits and vegetables
Includes 2 BPA free processing bowls: 16 cup (3.8 L) large bowl; 2.5 cup (600 milliliter) small processing bowl
LCD display displays count up and count down auto timer; Voltage: 110 to 120 Volts
Accessory storage box can be stored horizontally or vertically based on storage space; Stainless Steel Blades; Plastic Spatula

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,948 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
